text: Hi, does this only affect pages where content editors are able to add modules to their pages?
In my experience, yes. The only other case is when default content is changed inside of the website editor. Changing that default content in the template won’t affect the live module.

I can try to put together a video tonight but won’t have time during the day. Essentially, you want to make sure you finalize your coded drag-and-drop template before you start “dragging and dropping” inside of the website editor.
Because when you re-order modules or change column widths inside of the website editor it breaks the connection between that drag area and the coded template

For example:
1. you create a coded template with a draggable area and 3 default modules
2. you create a new website page from that coded template
3. inside of the website editor you change the column width of one of the modules and enter some content
4. now you decide to add a 4th default module to the coded template but you notice that updates to template no longer affect the website page
5. you would first need to delete the website page you made because the connection is broken in step 3
6. after you modify the coded template you generate a new website page and re-enter your content
